head.title: Calendar of Debt Sales Planned for This Week

hedline.hl1: Calendar of Debt Sales Planned for This Week

block.p: The Treasury's schedule of financings this week is confined to today's regular weekly auction of three- and six-month bills and a 10-year inflation index note on Wednesday.

By the close of the New York cash market on Friday, traders said, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 5.84 percent and a six-month bill was 5.91 percent. The yield on the current issue of the inflation index note was 4.00 percent.
The Treasury's schedule of financings this week is confined to today's regular weekly auction of three- and six-month bills and a 10-year inflation index note on Wednesday.

By the close of the New York cash market on Friday, traders said, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 5.84 percent and a six-month bill was 5.91 percent. The yield on the current issue of the inflation index note was 4.00 percent.
The following taxable and tax-exempt fixed-income issues are scheduled for pricing this week:
TAXABLE ONE DAY DURING THE WEEK
General Motors Acceptance Corp., plans to issue $2 billion of five-year global notes, A2/A/---. Bear, Stearns & Co.
Kingdom of Spain, $2 billion of five-year global notes. Deutsche Bank Alex. Brown.
Repsol International Finance, $700 million of five-year global notes. Bear, Stearns & Co.; Goldman, Sachs & Co. and Merrill Lynch & Co.
(Source: MCM CorporateWatch) Ratings: Moody's Investors Service/Standard & Poor's Corp./Duff & Phelps Credit.
TAX EXEMPT
MONDAY
Cypress-Fairbanks Independent School District, $100 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
TUESDAY

Clark County, Nev., $200 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive. Loudoun County, Va., $60 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive. Prince George's, Md., $78.2 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
ONE DAY DURING THE WEEK
Aurora, Colo., $76.3 million of certificates of participation. Dain Rauscher Inc.
California Housing Finance Authority, $80 million of single family mortgage bonds. Lehman Brothers.
California Statewide Community Development Authority, $55 million of debt securities for L.A. Orthopedic Hospital Foundation. J. P. Morgan Securities.
Illinois Housing Development Authority, $57 million of single-family bonds. Bear, Stearns & Co.
New York State Thruway, $460 million of debt securities. Morgan Stanley Dean Witter.
Purdue University Board of Trustees, $51.2 million of debt securities. PaineWebber Inc.
Yale University, $100 million of taxable medium-term notes. Goldman, Sachs & Co.
